title: How to Use the Technique of Panning

steps.headline: Pre-focus your lens (manual focus cameras) on a point along your subjects path where you intend to trip the shutter.
Swing the camera in a smooth evenly paced sweep so your subject remains in the same part of the view finder throughout.
steps.description: When you take the shot, just before the point is reached, squeeze the shutter release as you are moving to take the shot.

steps.headline: Continue to swing the camera past the point of focus even after the shutter is closed after the exposure.
steps.description: This helps to ensure a smooth result.

text: Pre-focus your lens (manual focus cameras) on a point along your subjects path where you intend to trip the shutter.  Swing the camera in a smooth evenly paced sweep so your subject remains in the same part of the view finder throughout. When you take the shot, just before the point is reached, squeeze the shutter release as you are moving to take the shot. Continue to swing the camera past the point of focus even after the shutter is closed after the exposure. This helps to ensure a smooth result.
